showerReviews.reviewText: Greenpoint is such a lovely place to stay when you are on a lean budget like in my case. The interior is super cool, clean and well-maintained. The personnel i met upon my arrival are very warm, welcoming and customer-friendly too. ‚Ä¶

Great location within 5 minutes walk to subway and surrounded with plenty of restaurants to choose from. Nice green park located stone throw away from hostel is a plus. Room I stayed in was clean and tidy, although some funny chemical smell ‚Ä¶

If you dont want to spend so much money in NY choose this place. We had deluxe room with 2 queen size beds and large wardrobe. Bathroom is shared and not always perfectly clean but it depens with who you stay there at the moment. Simple ‚Ä¶

It was a late booking chosen for reasons of location and price. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. The room was clean and warm. Unfortunately we were next to the Men's bathroom and there were frequent visitors during the night ‚Ä¶

I booked this place for my husband and son in September 2018. They stayed three nights there. We thought it would be a lively joyous place, simple, but clean, modest but fine. It turned out to be the worst experience they ever had in a ‚Ä¶

Me and my friend slept well on the beds and they were kind of comfortable to lay on. The shared bathroom was the worst part of the stay. It was uncomfortable and the bathrooms made all the hallways smell of urine. The men's bathroom should ‚Ä¶

When you go to this website, it looks like a pretty, simple, bright, clean "hotel-esque" place to stay at a great rate in a notoriously pricey area. That alone should have set me straight. The lobby is your typical YMCA, with kids coming ‚Ä¶

I stayed here for 3 days and for $70 US a night for my own room it was perfect. It is nothing fancy and you have to walk to the bathroom from your room but I had a comfortable bed, TV, air conditioning and the location was great. ||Close to ‚Ä¶

showerReviews.reviewText: ‚Ä¶ Last time I was there, two handymen showed up unannounced in the women‚Äôs lady‚Äôs room at 1pm while I was leaving the shower completely naked. I forgot to bring a towel in and I left the Y shaking with fear. Management is absent, you can ‚Ä¶

This is a review of the guys in the locker room who shower with the shower curtains open trying to get other guys to look at their junk, and then stand around the locker room naked, for way longer than necessary, trying to get other guys to ‚Ä¶
If you enjoy locker rooms where men shower with the curtains wide open while making direct eye contact with every lucky passer by, then this is the locker room for you! ‚Ä¶
Many people don't shower before entering swimming pools. Can the swimming pool staff remind them? Or Enforcement. Shower before entering the water (it helps keep the pool clean and protects you, too)

The pool is crowded even on weekdays at 11am and 2pm. The women‚Äôs shower room is often packed, and you have to line up for a shower even on weekdays. One time, I even smelled poop in the shower room. The staff is not friendly at all, they ‚Ä¶

*Minus one star for broken changing tables/baby seats. Shower knobs have recently been repaired as of Sept 2024.* Swim classes for littles (baby/toddler) are great. It's very hard to register for things (lessons or class/gym reservations) ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ .  They have two pools.  However, with my most recent visit, I noticed the gym has gotten so much more crowded.  The line for the woman shower was LONG.  There were at least 10 people waiting for shower.  The towels were always outside of ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ in locker room, two stars. Sauna and steam room don't work properly half of the time. Cleaning staff just shrugs about cockroaches complains. Lockers are blocked by cleaning crew belongings. Drains in shower area stink. Expensive.

showerReviews.reviewText: This review is about YMCA summer CAMP at the Vanderbilt location. Our experience was -very- ba, with broken promises of field trips, camp counselors who did little more than day care, and limited facilities. ‚Ä¶

I stayed 4 nights. Great dorm like accommodations. The rooms are small but sufficient. Has A/C, fridge, HD cable TV, comfortable bed.  The shower/restroom was ALWAYS clean.  Washer & dryers very convenient and appreciated. Front desk ‚Ä¶

The overall experience was pretty well. The room was clean and they were changing the towels every day. We went in November and the weather was very cold but in our room we had a heater which was working well. Sometimes it was even too hot ‚Ä¶

The pool is overly crowded. They really should require members to make appointments to go in so it‚Äôs not crowded all the time. I ran into a male maintenance person when I walked out of the shower in women locker room. That was a terrible experience and they did not make any announcements ahead.

showerReviews.reviewText: ‚Ä¶ tear showing as in most public facilities. It's not Equinox for sure. I would say the cleanliness is about a decent campground shower rooms. Shower was warm but not able to change the flow or head direction. I rinse, towel dry and get out. ‚Ä¶
I go to aquatic center often with my children.  Locker room is very dirty and  around 50% of shower don‚Äôt work. Many have missing shower curtain. It‚Äôs been like that more than 6 months. ‚Ä¶

The most horrible experience I‚Äôve ever had. The shower is dirty and nasty. Lap swim stuffed with people. And guess what, you cannot use hairdryer to dry your hair since there are no sockets in the locker room. And you are not allowed to dry ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ kept clean. No attendance cleaning regular basis. Life guards don't‚Äô care about people who does not take shower before coming into pool. Be careful taking kids to the pool because one lifeguard with bold hair threatens kids. He has his ‚Ä¶
‚Ä¶ The changing room can be a bit cleaner. The shower curtains need changes. And the hot water is so unstable with half of the showers often don't work.

Swimming pool is big,  nice, lane length 25 meters, but crowded. In the morning at least 3 people in each lane, but the locker room and showers are disaster. In showers most hanging hooks and shelves are broken. Recently someone fixed half ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ room's maintenance is terrible.  It is too small and dirty. Locker is small, too. No enough shower room, some of them even not working.  No one comes to repair. You always  need to wait on a line to get a shower. The park seems not to ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ room never fixed. Nearly half of the lockers are broken or locked by unused lock. Locker are too small to put your stuff. Half of the shower are broken and never fixed. Floor is always dirty and a lot of water. Little spaces for changing. ‚Ä¶

Just visited the pool yesterday ( 11/16)

50% of the women‚Äôs shower rooms didn‚Äôt have water or curtains. Management should regularly check the facilities and ensure that essential equipment like this is functioning properly.
‚Ä¶ Fix the shower room and increase the water pressure already. ‚Ä¶

This spa is disgusting and should be shut down!! Only one shower works, you‚Äôre rinsing off next to a trash can, half the saunas are broken, and no one warns you. Staff is rude you are even afraid to order something, towels are stained and ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ Start in the larger sauna taking quick breaks from heat with quick cold shower for the first 20 min which is located outside of sauna to open and close your pores. This allows you to tolerate more heat helping toxins to leave body. Enjoy ‚Ä¶
This place is small and not very clean. There were roaches in the pool and in the women‚Äôs shower. There was mildew and the place wasn‚Äôt very sanitary. The towels also smelled like mildew

Wish I could give zero stars, this place is unsanitary, smelly, and there was a baby cockroach in the shower - this was not a relaxing experience whatsoever!!! I couldn‚Äôt wait to get home to take a shower! - they need to some serious ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ wait another 5 and ended up waiting 10. Then the guy came and got me and told me to go back into the sauna and cold shower which was pretty annoying since I did that 5 times over already. I ended up leaving because it was beyond annoying ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ of weeks now and I really needed a good steam session. I knew I could count on sitting in a hot room as I‚Äôm at the end of a nasty cold. I enjoyed being in the Shvitz for an hour and taking the cold plunge shower. I go here because it‚Äôs HOT!

‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs truly authentic and the main sauna is amazing. Just bring your flip flops, use towels to sit, rinse off after sweating and bring toiletries to take a shower after you are done. The home style potatoes with garlic are delicious!
‚Ä¶ They had a slightly cold rainfall shower outside the sauna or if your adventurous a cold plung pool.
